events.title: Birth of Isaac Newton
events.description: Isaac Newton, an English mathematician and physicist, was born on January 4, 1643 (New Style) in Woolsthorpe Manor, England, later becoming a central figure of the scientific revolution.
events.significance: Established foundations of classical mechanics, gravitation, and calculus, shaping modern physics.

events.title: Birth of Louis Braille
events.description: Louis Braille, a French educator, was born on January 4, 1809 in Coupvray, France; he would invent the Braille tactile writing system for the blind.
events.significance: Braille enabled literacy and independent access to written information for blind and visually impaired people.

events.title: Utah becomes the 45th U.S. state
events.description: Utah is admitted to the United States as the 45th state on January 4, 1896.
events.significance: Expanded U.S. western statehood and representation in Congress.
